snippet: President Hamid Karzai’s pick to lead the Afghan spy agency, Asadullah Khalid, has been accused of torture and drug trafficking, but is also seen as a man with political skills and wide connections.
abstract: Afghanistan Pres Hamid Karzai's choice of close aid Asadullah Khalid as his next intelligence chief has divided Western officials; Khalid, who has a record of fighting the Taliban and close ties to the CIA, is also seen as a man with political skills and wide connections, but some are troubled by allegations of torture and drug trafficking against him.
lead_paragraph: President Hamid Karzai’s pick to lead the Afghan spy agency, Asadullah Khalid, has been accused of torture and drug trafficking, but is also seen as a man with political skills and wide connections.

headline.seo: Officials Split Over Nominee for Afghan Spy Chief
